a.title: Standard Work Day and Reporting Resolution
a.span: Standard Work Day and Reporting Resolution

li.a: Standard Work Day and Reporting Resolution

span.style: font-family: Tahoma; font-size: 18px; color: rgb(49, 133, 155);
text-decoration: underline;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

br.span: Effective March 23, 2020 - the buildings are closed to the public.

span.style: font-size: 22px; font-family: Tahoma; color: rgb(49, 133, 155);
color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-size: large;

p.span: Please call us at (518) 623-2861 if you are an essential worker and need assistance with childcare.

span.style: font-size: 14pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Warrensburg CSD Cafeteria Team and Staff

span.style: font-size: 14pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 14pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 16pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Warrensburg, NY – Superheroes aren’t just found in comic books or on the big screen. Some of the most important superheroes are everyday people in our community. Everyday people doing extraordinary things – making sure the nutritional needs of our students and their families are met seven days per week while schools are closed due to COVID-19. Food Service Director, Jessica West, and a team of WCSD volunteer staff are accomplishing this mission.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Though the daily feat of providing nutritious and delicious meals to students is not new, there were new challenges with the unprecedented state of affairs. One of the first and biggest being the packaging and portability of the meals. Initially, the team was packaging meals for pick-up on a daily basis. However, realizing that daily pick-up could be a challenge for some families, as well as the need to reduce the number of people helping on campus at any given time, the district received approval from the USDA to package seven days of meals together. “We typically don’t operate in providing ‘take-out’ so getting an efficient system in place to package the meals and ensure portability was our first new challenge.” stated Ms. West.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: The pick-up time and location the circle in front of the Elementary School on Friday’s from 11:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. There is an additional pick-up location, same day and time at the Thurman Town Hall. Members of the transportation department are delivering the meals to this location.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Food safety is always top priority. Of course, in the controlled conditions of the cafeteria, the crew has a careful handle on it. The meals needing refrigeration are packaged together, and all meals come complete with re-heating and refrigeration instructions. “

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: This model seems to be performing well, and students seem quite happy to have a variety other than cold deli sandwiches,” explained Ms. West. Recently, the district received a donation of frozen french fries, courtesy of Irving Tissue, which will add some variety.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Ms. West shared that at the time the program first began, approximately 125 were being served. Since that time, the numbers have been exponentially growing, and now approximately 225 students are being reached. “Families who initially did not need the service are now reaching out, and we are happy to help,” Ms. West said.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: It is never too late to sign up for this service. Families may do so by calling

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 10pt;

strong.style: text-align: center; font-family: "Bookman Old Style", serif; font-size: 13.3333px; font-style: italic;

span.style: font-size: 18px;

strong.span: "We educate, nurture, and empower students within a safe and supportive environment to become respectful and successful citizens of the global community."
